job_title: Principal Software Engineer - Detection Platform - Secureworks
job_description: Principal Software Engineer- Detection Platform Team - Secureworks About Secureworks Secureworks (NASDAQ: SCWX) is a global cybersecurity leader that secures human progress with Secureworks® Taegis™, a SaaS-based, open XDR platform built on 20+ years of real-world threat intelligence and research, improving customers’ ability to detect advanced threats, streamline and collaborate on investigations, and automate the right actions. We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about “what’s next.” We offer flexible work options when available, and emphasize the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team. Role Overview The Detection Platform team builds software which empowers security practitioners to build, maintain, and extend detections to outpace the adversary. We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Software Engineer to join our Detection Platforms team. You will play a crucial role in developing and enhancing the core detection capabilities of our market-leading XDR solution, working in a fast-paced, startup-like environment with an experienced, cross-functional team of software engineers, data scientists, and security experts. If you love computer security and digging into complex engineering challenges, then we want your help to protect organizations in the digitally connected world! We operate our systems at scale with high availability and elasticity. Our primary tech stack consists of Golang, Kubernetes, Kafka, Elasticsearch, and GraphQL, but we also use tools like S3, ScyllaDB, Redis, SQS and many other AWS services. Minimum Requirements: At least 5 years of software development experience in languages such as GoLang, Java, Scala and a solid foundation in algorithms and data structures A proactive mindset with excellent problem-solving and communication skills Experience with big data technologies such as Apache Kafka, Spark, Hadoop, or similar systems. Preferred Skills: Demonstrated experience with scripting languages like Python, Bash, etc Testing and troubleshooting skills with the ability to walk from UI down to backend services and track where problems are happening Experience developing and deploying production systems with cloud platforms like AWS or GCP and orchestrations systems like Kubernetes Experience working with blended teams of backend and frontend engineers, product managers, and user experience researchers Knowledge of cyber security domain Work Environment We are a remote first team and are geographically distributed across the US, Canada, and UK - we utilize tools to facilitate communication and collaboration like Slack, Google Meet, Google Docs, Miro, and Lucid Charts. We also believe in a strong work-life balance and providing support for team members to accomplish that. We are also a family-first company that values our team members and has benefits and a culture that will help them through important life events, such as caring for family, parental leave, etc. We also value continuing education and skills development through things like internal tech talks, external technical presentations to our teams, and other opportunities for training and education.
